intro: Acrachne racemosa var. sumanensis, commonly known as the Sumanese acrachne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
